paper_abstract: This paper proposes two new algorithms for inference in credal networks. These algorithms enable probability intervals to be obtained for the states of a given query variable. The first algorithm is approximate and uses the hill-climbing technique in the Shenoy-Shafer architecture to propagate in join trees; the second is exact and is a modification of Rocha and Cozman's branch-and-bound algorithm, but applied to general directed acyclic graphs, (C) 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Hill-climbing and branch-and-bound algorithms for exact and approximate inference in credal networks
